data.title: Andrea Chapman
data.meta_description: Andrea Chapman is the principal deputy director of the Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR) at the Administration for Children and Families in the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS).
data.text:
Andrea Chapman is the principal deputy director of the Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR) at the Administration for Children and Families in the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). The office is responsible for services to unaccompanied children, refugees, asylees, Cuban and Haitian entrants, Special Immigrant Visa holders and survivors of torture.

Before joining ORR, Chapman was the director of the Office of Strategy, Performance and Results at HHS’s Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS). In this role she led the deployment of the agency’s enterprise-wide capabilities focused on strategic planning, enterprise risk management, data strategy and insights, project management and continuous improvement.

Prior to her work at CMS, Chapman led multiple modernization efforts at the Internal Revenue Service, focused on tax processing, enterprise risk management and financial management operations. She also served the chairman of the Senate Finance Committee as a staff member in the 112th Congress.
